applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to the document for several key reasons: 1) The document describes a pension life cover scheme that provides death benefits only - it is not an insurance policy that can be automatically renewed. The scheme rules explicitly state it is 'to provide benefits for the member's dependants if the member dies before normal retirement age' and terminates either on death or at normal retirement age. 2) The scheme is established as a one-time setup through a letter of exchange and policy, not as a renewable insurance contract. 3) The document contains no provisions for policy renewal or automatic renewal processes, as this type of pension scheme by its nature continues until termination/wind-up events specified in Section 5 of the rules. 4) The regulation specifically applies to insurance policies with durations of 10 months or more that have automatic renewal features, while this document describes a continuous pension scheme structure that remains in force until specific termination events occur. Therefore, the automatic renewal notification requirements in Regulation 325 are not applicable to this type of pension scheme product.
regulation_title: Automatic renewals - notifications in respect of policies with a duration of 10 months or more
regulation_text: 325. (1) Where an insurance undertaking or an insurance intermediary proposes to automatically renew a consumer's insurance policy, with a duration of 10 months or more, the insurance undertaking or insurance intermediary shall provide a notification on paper or on another durable medium to the consumer at least 20 working days prior to the renewal date of the insurance policy which shall include the following: (a) a statement that the insurance policy will renew automatically if the consumer does not cancel the automatic renewal before a specified date; (b) details on how the consumer can stop the automatic renewal of the insurance policy if the consumer does not wish to automatically renew, including - (i) the existence of the right to cancel the automatic renewal of the insurance policy, (ii) the conditions for exercising the right to cancel the automatic renewal of the insurance policy, (iii) the consequences of exercising the right to cancel the automatic renewal of the insurance policy, and (iv) the practical steps required for exercising the right to cancel the automatic renewal of the insurance policy, including, at a minimum, the options available for cancelling the automatic renewal of the insurance policy; (c) except where Section 14(6) of the Act of 2019 applies, confirmation of any changes to the terms of the insurance policy upon renewal; (d) details of any fee payable specifically in respect of the automatic renewal of the insurance policy and the services provided for such fee; (e) the website address of the relevant section of the Competition and Consumer Protection Commission's website and, where relevant, the Health Insurance Authority's website relating to getting insurance quotes; (f) a statement that the consumer should keep their insurance arrangements under review as there may be other alternatives in the market that could provide savings for the consumer for similar cover. (2) Where an automatic renewal arrangement of a consumer's insurance policy, with a duration of 10 months or more, is in place and the insurance undertaking or insurance intermediary does not propose to renew such insurance policy, the insurance undertaking or insurance intermediary shall provide a notification on paper or on another durable medium to the consumer at least 20 working days prior to the renewal date that the insurance undertaking or insurance intermediary does not wish to invite a renewal. (3) Paragraph (2) does not apply where Regulation 5(1)(b) of the Non -Life Insurance (Provision of Information) Regulations 2007 applies.
